Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from ddgs import DDGS import time print('=== OPERATION FORAGER DESTROYER & OPERATION MIDNIGHT SUN SUBMARINE COMMANDER RESEARCH ===') print('Objective: Find destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun') print('Strategy: Research both military operations to identify the naval command connection\n') # Create workspace directory workspace = 'workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok=True) print(f'✓ Workspace directory ready: {workspace}') # Initialize research data structure for military operations research_data = { 'operation_forager': { 'description': 'WWII Pacific operation - invasion of Mariana Islands', 'destroyers': [], 'commanders': [], 'search_results': [] }, 'operation_midnight_sun': { 'description': 'Soviet nuclear intelligence mission', 'submarines': [], 'commanders': [], 'search_results': [] }, 'command_connections': [], 'all_search_results': [] } print('\n=== STEP 1: RESEARCHING OPERATION FORAGER (WWII PACIFIC) ===\n') # Search for Operation Forager information - WWII Pacific operation print('Searching for Operation Forager details (Mariana Islands invasion)...') searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) forager_queries = [ 'Operation Forager destroyers WWII Pacific Mariana Islands', 'Operation Forager naval ships commanders Saipan Guam', 'Operation Forager destroyer captains officers 1944', 'USS destroyers Operation Forager Mariana campaign', 'Operation Forager Task Force 58 destroyers' ] for query in forager_queries: print(f'\nSearching: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Store result research_data['operation_forager']['search_results'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) research_data['all_search_results'].append({ 'operation': 'forager', 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting between searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('\n=== STEP 2: RESEARCHING OPERATION MIDNIGHT SUN (SOVIET SUBMARINE) ===\n') # Search for Operation Midnight Sun information - Soviet submarine operation print('Searching for Operation Midnight Sun details (Soviet submarine nuclear intelligence)...') midnight_sun_queries = [ 'Operation Midnight Sun Soviet submarine nuclear intelligence mission', 'Midnight Sun submarine operation Soviet nuclear failed mission', 'Soviet submarine Operation Midnight Sun commander officer', 'Operation Midnight Sun Soviet nuclear submarine captain', 'Midnight Sun Soviet submarine intelligence operation commander' ] for query in midnight_sun_queries: print(f'\nSearching: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Store result research_data['operation_midnight_sun']['search_results'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) research_data['all_search_results'].append({ 'operation': 'midnight_sun', 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting between searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR NAVAL COMMAND CONNECTIONS ===\n') # Search for connections between submarine and destroyer commanders print('Searching for naval officer connections between submarine and destroyer commands...') connection_queries = [ 'submarine commander destroyer captain WWII Pacific naval officer', 'Operation Forager destroyer captain previous submarine command', 'WWII destroyer captain former submarine commander Pacific fleet', 'naval officer submarine destroyer command transition WWII', 'Pacific fleet submarine commander destroyer captain same officer' ] for query in connection_queries: print(f'\nSearching: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Store result research_data['all_search_results'].append({ 'operation': 'connection', 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting between searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('\n=== STEP 4: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR MILITARY OPERATIONS ===\n') # Analyze the collected search results print('Analyzing search results for key military information...') total_results = len(research_data['all_search_results']) print(f'Total search results collected: {total_results}') # Count results by operation type forager_results = [r for r in research_data['all_search_results'] if r['operation'] == 'forager'] midnight_sun_results = [r for r in research_data['all_search_results'] if r['operation'] == 'midnight_sun'] connection_results = [r for r in research_data['all_search_results'] if r['operation'] == 'connection'] print(f'Operation Forager results: {len(forager_results)}') print(f'Operation Midnight Sun results: {len(midnight_sun_results)}') print(f'Connection search results: {len(connection_results)}') # Look for key military terms in the results key_military_terms = { 'destroyer': 0, 'submarine': 0, 'commander': 0, 'captain': 0, 'forager': 0, 'midnight sun': 0, 'saipan': 0, 'guam': 0, 'mariana': 0, 'soviet': 0, 'nuclear': 0, 'uss': 0, 'naval': 0, 'pacific': 0, 'wwii': 0 } for result in research_data['all_search_results']: combined_text = (result['title'] + ' ' + result['snippet']).lower() for term in key_military_terms: key_military_terms[term] += combined_text.count(term) print('\nKey military term frequency across all results:') for term, count in key_military_terms.items(): if count > 0: print(f' {term}: {count} occurrences') print('\n=== STEP 5: IDENTIFYING MOST PROMISING RESULTS ===\n') # Score results based on relevance to our military research objective promising_results = [] for result in research_data['all_search_results']: combined_text = (result['title'] + ' ' + result['snippet']).lower() # Military relevance scoring score = 0 # High value combinations if 'destroyer' in combined_text and 'commander' in combined_text: score += 5 if 'submarine' in combined_text and 'commander' in combined_text: score += 5 if 'destroyer' in combined_text and 'captain' in combined_text: score += 4 if 'submarine' in combined_text and 'captain' in combined_text: score += 4 # Operation-specific terms if 'forager' in combined_text: score += 3 if 'midnight sun' in combined_text: score += 3 if 'mariana' in combined_text: score += 2 if 'saipan' in combined_text or 'guam' in combined_text: score += 2 # General military terms if 'uss' in combined_text: score += 2 if 'naval' in combined_text: score += 1 if 'pacific' in combined_text: score += 1 if 'wwii' in combined_text or '1944' in combined_text: score += 1 if 'soviet' in combined_text: score += 1 # Command transition indicators if 'previous' in combined_text or 'former' in combined_text: score += 2 if 'transition' in combined_text or 'transfer' in combined_text: score += 2 if score >= 4: # Only include results with significant military relevance promising_results.append({ 'result': result, 'score': score }) # Sort by relevance score promising_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) print(f'Found {len(promising_results)} highly relevant military results:') for i, item in enumerate(promising_results[:8], 1): # Show top 8 result = item['result'] score = item['score'] print(f'\n{i}. Relevance Score: {score}') print(f' Operation: {result["operation"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:150]}...') print('\n=== STEP 6: ACCESSING DETAILED MILITARY SOURCES ===\n') # Access the most promising military sources for detailed information headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } accessed_military_content = [] for i, item in enumerate(promising_results[:5], 1): # Access top 5 most promising result = item['result'] url = result['url'] print(f'Accessing military source {i}: {result["title"][:60]}...') print(f'URL: {url}') print(f'Operation focus: {result["operation"]}') print(f'Relevance score: {item["score"]}') try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: print(f'Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Parse the military content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(['script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Get text content text_content = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() for line in text_content.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(' ')) clean_text = ' '.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk) # Save the military content content_file = os.path.join(workspace, f'military_source_{i}_{result["operation"]}.txt') with open(content_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(f'URL: {url}\n') f.write(f'Title: {result["title"]}\n') f.write(f'Operation: {result["operation"]}\n') f.write(f'Relevance Score: {item["score"]}\n') f.write(f'Query: {result["query"]}\n') f.write('\n' + '='*80 + '\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f'✓ Military content saved to: {content_file}') # Extract military information from the content content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look for ship names and military commanders ship_indicators = ['destroyer', 'dd-', 'uss ', 'submarine'] commander_indicators = ['commander', 'captain', 'commanding officer', 'co ', 'admiral'] found_ships = [] found_commanders = [] # Extract potential ship names and commanders words = clean_text.split() for j, word in enumerate(words): # Look for USS ship names if word.lower() == 'uss' and j + 1 < len(words): potential_ship = words[j + 1] if len(potential_ship) > 2 and potential_ship[0].isupper(): found_ships.append(f'USS {potential_ship}') # Look for destroyer designations if word.lower().startswith('dd-') and len(word) > 3: found_ships.append(word.upper()) # Look for commanders and captains if word.lower() in ['commander', 'captain', 'admiral'] and j + 1 < len(words): potential_commander = words[j + 1] if len(potential_commander) > 2 and potential_commander[0].isupper(): found_commanders.append(f'{word} {potential_commander}') # Remove duplicates found_ships = list(set(found_ships)) found_commanders = list(set(found_commanders)) if found_ships: print(f' Ships/Vessels found: {found_ships[:8]}') if found_commanders: print(f' Military commanders found: {found_commanders[:8]}') # Count military terms in this specific content content_military_terms = { 'operation forager': content_lower.count('operation forager'), 'midnight sun': content_lower.count('midnight sun'), 'destroyer': content_lower.count('destroyer'), 'submarine': content_lower.count('submarine'), 'commander': content_lower.count('commander'), 'captain': content_lower.count('captain'), 'mariana': content_lower.count('mariana'), 'saipan': content_lower.count('saipan'), 'guam': content_lower.count('guam'), 'soviet': content_lower.count('soviet'), 'nuclear': content_lower.count('nuclear') } print(' Military terms in this content:') for term, count in content_military_terms.items(): if count > 0: print(f' {term}: {count}') accessed_military_content.append({ 'url': url, 'title': result['title'], 'operation': result['operation'], 'score': item['score'], 'content_file': content_file, 'ships_found': found_ships[:8], 'commanders_found': found_commanders[:8], 'term_counts': content_military_terms }) else: print(f' Failed to access: HTTP {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' Error accessing URL: {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting between requests print('=== STEP 7: COMPREHENSIVE MILITARY OPERATIONS ANALYSIS ===\n') print('🎯 MILITARY RESEARCH PROGRESS SUMMARY:') print(f'✓ Executed {len(forager_queries)} Operation Forager searches') print(f'✓ Executed {len(midnight_sun_queries)} Operation Midnight Sun searches') print(f'✓ Executed {len(connection_queries)} command connection searches') print(f'✓ Collected {total_results} total military search results') print(f'✓ Identified {len(promising_results)} high-relevance military results') print(f'✓ Successfully accessed {len(accessed_military_content)} detailed military sources') print('\n📊 KEY MILITARY FINDINGS:') if accessed_military_content: print('Detailed military content analysis from accessed sources:') for content in accessed_military_content: print(f'\n• Military Source: {content["title"][:60]}...') print(f' Operation focus: {content["operation"]}') print(f' Relevance score: {content["score"]}') if content['ships_found']: print(f' Ships/Vessels mentioned: {content["ships_found"]}') if content['commanders_found']: print(f' Military commanders mentioned: {content["commanders_found"]}') print(f' Content saved to: {content["content_file"]}') else: print('No detailed military content successfully accessed yet') print('\n🔍 NEXT MILITARY RESEARCH STEPS:') print('1. Access additional military sources from search results') print('2. Search for specific destroyer names and hull numbers from Operation Forager') print('3. Research naval officer career transitions from submarine to destroyer command') print('4. Cross-reference Operation Midnight Sun submarine commanders with Pacific Fleet records') print('5. Look for naval personnel records and command histories linking both operations') print('6. Search for specific time periods when officers transitioned between commands') # Save comprehensive military analysis military_analysis_data = { 'research_objective': 'Find destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun', 'operations_researched': { 'operation_forager': 'WWII Pacific operation - invasion of Mariana Islands (Saipan, Guam, Tinian)', 'operation_midnight_sun': 'Soviet nuclear intelligence submarine mission' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(forager_queries) + len(midnight_sun_queries) + len(connection_queries), 'total_results': total_results, 'promising_results': len(promising_results), 'accessed_sources': len(accessed_military_content) }, 'military_term_analysis': key_military_terms, 'top_promising_results': [item['result'] for item in promising_results[:10]], 'accessed_military_content_summary': accessed_military_content, 'next_research_targets': [ 'Specific Operation Forager destroyer lists and hull numbers', 'Operation Midnight Sun submarine commander identification', 'Naval officer career progression records WWII-era', 'Pacific Fleet command assignments and transitions', 'Cross-reference submarine and destroyer command histories' ], 'timestamp': 'military_operations_research_phase_1_complete' } military_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace, 'military_operations_connection_analysis.json') with open(military_analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(military_analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n✓ Comprehensive military analysis saved to: {military_analysis_file}') print('\n*** MILITARY OPERATIONS RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ***') print('Status: Successfully initiated research into both military operations') print('Objective: Continue searching for the specific naval command connection') print('Strategy: Focus next on detailed naval records, ship rosters, and officer assignments') print('\nFiles created in workspace:') for filename in os.listdir(workspace): if filename.startswith('military_'): print(f' - {filename}')
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from ddgs import DDGS import time print('=== OPERATION FORAGER DESTROYER & OPERATION MIDNIGHT SUN SUBMARINE COMMANDER RESEARCH ===') print('Objective: Find destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun') print('Strategy: Research both military operations to identify the naval command connection\n') # Create workspace directory workspace = 'workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok=True) print(f'✓ Workspace directory ready: {workspace}') # Initialize research data structure for military operations research_data = { 'operation_forager': { 'description': 'WWII Pacific operation - invasion of Mariana Islands', 'destroyers': [], 'commanders': [], 'search_results': [] }, 'operation_midnight_sun': { 'description': 'Soviet nuclear intelligence mission', 'submarines': [], 'commanders': [], 'search_results': [] }, 'command_connections': [], 'all_search_results': [] } print('\n=== STEP 1: RESEARCHING OPERATION FORAGER (WWII PACIFIC) ===\n') # Search for Operation Forager information - WWII Pacific operation print('Searching for Operation Forager details (Mariana Islands invasion)...') searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) forager_queries = [ 'Operation Forager destroyers WWII Pacific Mariana Islands', 'Operation Forager naval ships commanders Saipan Guam', 'Operation Forager destroyer captains officers 1944', 'USS destroyers Operation Forager Mariana campaign', 'Operation Forager Task Force 58 destroyers' ] for query in forager_queries: print(f'\nSearching: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Store result research_data['operation_forager']['search_results'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) research_data['all_search_results'].append({ 'operation': 'forager', 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting between searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('\n=== STEP 2: RESEARCHING OPERATION MIDNIGHT SUN (SOVIET SUBMARINE) ===\n') # Search for Operation Midnight Sun information - Soviet submarine operation print('Searching for Operation Midnight Sun details (Soviet submarine nuclear intelligence)...') midnight_sun_queries = [ 'Operation Midnight Sun Soviet submarine nuclear intelligence mission', 'Midnight Sun submarine operation Soviet nuclear failed mission', 'Soviet submarine Operation Midnight Sun commander officer', 'Operation Midnight Sun Soviet nuclear submarine captain', 'Midnight Sun Soviet submarine intelligence operation commander' ] for query in midnight_sun_queries: print(f'\nSearching: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Store result research_data['operation_midnight_sun']['search_results'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) research_data['all_search_results'].append({ 'operation': 'midnight_sun', 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting between searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR NAVAL COMMAND CONNECTIONS ===\n') # Search for connections between submarine and destroyer commanders print('Searching for naval officer connections between submarine and destroyer commands...') connection_queries = [ 'submarine commander destroyer captain WWII Pacific naval officer', 'Operation Forager destroyer captain previous submarine command', 'WWII destroyer captain former submarine commander Pacific fleet', 'naval officer submarine destroyer command transition WWII', 'Pacific fleet submarine commander destroyer captain same officer' ] for query in connection_queries: print(f'\nSearching: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Store result research_data['all_search_results'].append({ 'operation': 'connection', 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'] }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting between searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error searching for "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('\n=== STEP 4: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR MILITARY OPERATIONS ===\n') # Analyze the collected search results print('Analyzing search results for key military information...') total_results = len(research_data['all_search_results']) print(f'Total search results collected: {total_results}') # Count results by operation type forager_results = [r for r in research_data['all_search_results'] if r['operation'] == 'forager'] midnight_sun_results = [r for r in research_data['all_search_results'] if r['operation'] == 'midnight_sun'] connection_results = [r for r in research_data['all_search_results'] if r['operation'] == 'connection'] print(f'Operation Forager results: {len(forager_results)}') print(f'Operation Midnight Sun results: {len(midnight_sun_results)}') print(f'Connection search results: {len(connection_results)}') # Look for key military terms in the results key_military_terms = { 'destroyer': 0, 'submarine': 0, 'commander': 0, 'captain': 0, 'forager': 0, 'midnight sun': 0, 'saipan': 0, 'guam': 0, 'mariana': 0, 'soviet': 0, 'nuclear': 0, 'uss': 0, 'naval': 0, 'pacific': 0, 'wwii': 0 } for result in research_data['all_search_results']: combined_text = (result['title'] + ' ' + result['snippet']).lower() for term in key_military_terms: key_military_terms[term] += combined_text.count(term) print('\nKey military term frequency across all results:') for term, count in key_military_terms.items(): if count > 0: print(f' {term}: {count} occurrences') print('\n=== STEP 5: IDENTIFYING MOST PROMISING RESULTS ===\n') # Score results based on relevance to our military research objective promising_results = [] for result in research_data['all_search_results']: combined_text = (result['title'] + ' ' + result['snippet']).lower() # Military relevance scoring score = 0 # High value combinations if 'destroyer' in combined_text and 'commander' in combined_text: score += 5 if 'submarine' in combined_text and 'commander' in combined_text: score += 5 if 'destroyer' in combined_text and 'captain' in combined_text: score += 4 if 'submarine' in combined_text and 'captain' in combined_text: score += 4 # Operation-specific terms if 'forager' in combined_text: score += 3 if 'midnight sun' in combined_text: score += 3 if 'mariana' in combined_text: score += 2 if 'saipan' in combined_text or 'guam' in combined_text: score += 2 # General military terms if 'uss' in combined_text: score += 2 if 'naval' in combined_text: score += 1 if 'pacific' in combined_text: score += 1 if 'wwii' in combined_text or '1944' in combined_text: score += 1 if 'soviet' in combined_text: score += 1 # Command transition indicators if 'previous' in combined_text or 'former' in combined_text: score += 2 if 'transition' in combined_text or 'transfer' in combined_text: score += 2 if score >= 4: # Only include results with significant military relevance promising_results.append({ 'result': result, 'score': score }) # Sort by relevance score promising_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) print(f'Found {len(promising_results)} highly relevant military results:') for i, item in enumerate(promising_results[:8], 1): # Show top 8 result = item['result'] score = item['score'] print(f'\n{i}. Relevance Score: {score}') print(f' Operation: {result["operation"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:150]}...') print('\n=== STEP 6: ACCESSING DETAILED MILITARY SOURCES ===\n') # Access the most promising military sources for detailed information headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } accessed_military_content = [] for i, item in enumerate(promising_results[:5], 1): # Access top 5 most promising result = item['result'] url = result['url'] print(f'Accessing military source {i}: {result["title"][:60]}...') print(f'URL: {url}') print(f'Operation focus: {result["operation"]}') print(f'Relevance score: {item["score"]}') try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: print(f'Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Parse the military content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(['script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Get text content text_content = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() for line in text_content.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(' ')) clean_text = ' '.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk) # Save the military content content_file = os.path.join(workspace, f'military_source_{i}_{result["operation"]}.txt') with open(content_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(f'URL: {url}\n') f.write(f'Title: {result["title"]}\n') f.write(f'Operation: {result["operation"]}\n') f.write(f'Relevance Score: {item["score"]}\n') f.write(f'Query: {result["query"]}\n') f.write('\n' + '='*80 + '\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f'✓ Military content saved to: {content_file}') # Extract military information from the content content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look for ship names and military commanders ship_indicators = ['destroyer', 'dd-', 'uss ', 'submarine'] commander_indicators = ['commander', 'captain', 'commanding officer', 'co ', 'admiral'] found_ships = [] found_commanders = [] # Extract potential ship names and commanders words = clean_text.split() for j, word in enumerate(words): # Look for USS ship names if word.lower() == 'uss' and j + 1 < len(words): potential_ship = words[j + 1] if len(potential_ship) > 2 and potential_ship[0].isupper(): found_ships.append(f'USS {potential_ship}') # Look for destroyer designations if word.lower().startswith('dd-') and len(word) > 3: found_ships.append(word.upper()) # Look for commanders and captains if word.lower() in ['commander', 'captain', 'admiral'] and j + 1 < len(words): potential_commander = words[j + 1] if len(potential_commander) > 2 and potential_commander[0].isupper(): found_commanders.append(f'{word} {potential_commander}') # Remove duplicates found_ships = list(set(found_ships)) found_commanders = list(set(found_commanders)) if found_ships: print(f' Ships/Vessels found: {found_ships[:8]}') if found_commanders: print(f' Military commanders found: {found_commanders[:8]}') # Count military terms in this specific content content_military_terms = { 'operation forager': content_lower.count('operation forager'), 'midnight sun': content_lower.count('midnight sun'), 'destroyer': content_lower.count('destroyer'), 'submarine': content_lower.count('submarine'), 'commander': content_lower.count('commander'), 'captain': content_lower.count('captain'), 'mariana': content_lower.count('mariana'), 'saipan': content_lower.count('saipan'), 'guam': content_lower.count('guam'), 'soviet': content_lower.count('soviet'), 'nuclear': content_lower.count('nuclear') } print(' Military terms in this content:') for term, count in content_military_terms.items(): if count > 0: print(f' {term}: {count}') accessed_military_content.append({ 'url': url, 'title': result['title'], 'operation': result['operation'], 'score': item['score'], 'content_file': content_file, 'ships_found': found_ships[:8], 'commanders_found': found_commanders[:8], 'term_counts': content_military_terms }) else: print(f' Failed to access: HTTP {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' Error accessing URL: {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting between requests print('=== STEP 7: COMPREHENSIVE MILITARY OPERATIONS ANALYSIS ===\n') print('🎯 MILITARY RESEARCH PROGRESS SUMMARY:') print(f'✓ Executed {len(forager_queries)} Operation Forager searches') print(f'✓ Executed {len(midnight_sun_queries)} Operation Midnight Sun searches') print(f'✓ Executed {len(connection_queries)} command connection searches') print(f'✓ Collected {total_results} total military search results') print(f'✓ Identified {len(promising_results)} high-relevance military results') print(f'✓ Successfully accessed {len(accessed_military_content)} detailed military sources') print('\n📊 KEY MILITARY FINDINGS:') if accessed_military_content: print('Detailed military content analysis from accessed sources:') for content in accessed_military_content: print(f'\n• Military Source: {content["title"][:60]}...') print(f' Operation focus: {content["operation"]}') print(f' Relevance score: {content["score"]}') if content['ships_found']: print(f' Ships/Vessels mentioned: {content["ships_found"]}') if content['commanders_found']: print(f' Military commanders mentioned: {content["commanders_found"]}') print(f' Content saved to: {content["content_file"]}') else: print('No detailed military content successfully accessed yet') print('\n🔍 NEXT MILITARY RESEARCH STEPS:') print('1. Access additional military sources from search results') print('2. Search for specific destroyer names and hull numbers from Operation Forager') print('3. Research naval officer career transitions from submarine to destroyer command') print('4. Cross-reference Operation Midnight Sun submarine commanders with Pacific Fleet records') print('5. Look for naval personnel records and command histories linking both operations') print('6. Search for specific time periods when officers transitioned between commands') # Save comprehensive military analysis military_analysis_data = { 'research_objective': 'Find destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun', 'operations_researched': { 'operation_forager': 'WWII Pacific operation - invasion of Mariana Islands (Saipan, Guam, Tinian)', 'operation_midnight_sun': 'Soviet nuclear intelligence submarine mission' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(forager_queries) + len(midnight_sun_queries) + len(connection_queries), 'total_results': total_results, 'promising_results': len(promising_results), 'accessed_sources': len(accessed_military_content) }, 'military_term_analysis': key_military_terms, 'top_promising_results': [item['result'] for item in promising_results[:10]], 'accessed_military_content_summary': accessed_military_content, 'next_research_targets': [ 'Specific Operation Forager destroyer lists and hull numbers', 'Operation Midnight Sun submarine commander identification', 'Naval officer career progression records WWII-era', 'Pacific Fleet command assignments and transitions', 'Cross-reference submarine and destroyer command histories' ], 'timestamp': 'military_operations_research_phase_1_complete' } military_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace, 'military_operations_connection_analysis.json') with open(military_analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(military_analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n✓ Comprehensive military analysis saved to: {military_analysis_file}') print('\n*** MILITARY OPERATIONS RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ***') print('Status: Successfully initiated research into both military operations') print('Objective: Continue searching for the specific naval command connection') print('Strategy: Focus next on detailed naval records, ship rosters, and officer assignments') print('\nFiles created in workspace:') for filename in os.listdir(workspace): if filename.startswith('military_'): print(f' - {filename}')
Execution Output

URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_submarine_K-129_(1960) Operation focus: midnight_sun Relevance score: 10 Status: 200 Content length: 262,382 bytes ✓ Military content saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/military_source_4_midnight_sun.txt Ships/Vessels found: ['USS Cochino,', 'USS Augusta.', 'USS Archerfish', 'USS Saufley', 'USS Condor', 'USS West', 'USS Scorpion.', 'USS Swordfish[edit]'] Military commanders found: ['Admiral Rudolf', 'Admiral Viktor', 'Captain Second', 'Admiral William', 'Admiral Peter', 'Captain First'] Military terms in this content: submarine: 75 commander: 4 captain: 5 soviet: 84 nuclear: 21 Accessing military source 5: Diesel Sub Commander Recalls Historic Soviet Sub Chase... URL: https://quietwarriors.wordpress.com/2014/05/30/diesel-sub-commander-recalls-historic-soviet-sub-chase/ Operation focus: midnight_sun Relevance score: 10 Status: 200 Content length: 98,941 bytes ✓ Military content saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/military_source_5_midnight_sun.txt Ships/Vessels found: ['USS Amberjack', 'USS George', 'USS Grampus', 'USS Sennet', 'USS Grenadier', 'USS Perch', 'USS Atule'] Military commanders found: ['Commander Recalls', 'Commander Submarine'] Military terms in this content: submarine: 62 commander: 8 captain: 1 soviet: 27 nuclear: 1 === STEP 7: COMPREHENSIVE MILITARY OPERATIONS ANALYSIS === 🎯 MILITARY RESEARCH PROGRESS SUMMARY: ✓ Executed 5 Operation Forager searches ✓ Executed 5 Operation Midnight Sun searches ✓ Executed 5 command connection searches ✓ Collected 120 total military search results ✓ Identified 41 high-relevance military results ✓ Successfully accessed 3 detailed military sources 📊 KEY MILITARY FINDINGS: Detailed military content analysis from accessed sources: • Military Source: Records of Naval Operating Forces... Operation focus: connection Relevance score: 12 Military commanders mentioned: ['Commander Base', 'Commander Mideast', 'Commander Mine', 'Commander Carrier', 'Commander U.S.', 'Commander Cruiser', 'Commander Submarines', 'Commander Motor'] Content saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/military_source_2_connection.txt • Military Source: Soviet submarine K-129 (1960)... Operation focus: midnight_sun Relevance score: 10 Ships/Vessels mentioned: ['USS Cochino,', 'USS Augusta.', 'USS Archerfish', 'USS Saufley', 'USS Condor', 'USS West', 'USS Scorpion.', 'USS Swordfish[edit]'] Military commanders mentioned: ['Admiral Rudolf', 'Admiral Viktor', 'Captain Second', 'Admiral William', 'Admiral Peter', 'Captain First'] Content saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/military_source_4_midnight_sun.txt • Military Source: Diesel Sub Commander Recalls Historic Soviet Sub Chase... Operation focus: midnight_sun Relevance score: 10 Ships/Vessels mentioned: ['USS Amberjack', 'USS George', 'USS Grampus', 'USS Sennet', 'USS Grenadier', 'USS Perch', 'USS Atule'] Military commanders mentioned: ['Commander Recalls', 'Commander Submarine'] Content saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/military_source_5_midnight_sun.txt 🔍 NEXT MILITARY RESEARCH STEPS: 1. Access additional military sources from search results 2. Search for specific destroyer names and hull numbers from Operation Forager 3. Research naval officer career transitions from submarine to destroyer command 4. Cross-reference Operation Midnight Sun submarine commanders with Pacific Fleet records 5. Look for naval personnel records and command histories linking both operations 6. Search for specific time periods when officers transitioned between commands ✓ Comprehensive military analysis saved to: workspace_webshaper_32/military_operations_connection_analysis.json *** MILITARY OPERATIONS RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE *** Status: Successfully initiated research into both military operations Objective: Continue searching for the specific naval command connection Strategy: Focus next on detailed naval records, ship rosters, and officer assignments Files created in workspace: - military_source_5_midnight_sun.txt - military_source_4_midnight_sun.txt - military_operations_connection_analysis.json - military_source_2_connection.txt

2025-08-08 16:14:32
Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from ddgs import DDGS import time print('=== PHASE 2: DETAILED MILITARY RECORDS & COMMAND CONNECTION ANALYSIS ===') print('Objective: Identify specific destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun') print('Strategy: Analyze saved military data and conduct targeted searches for naval command connections\n') # Create workspace directory workspace = 'workspace' os.makedirs(workspace, exist_ok=True) print(f'✓ Workspace directory ready: {workspace}') print('\n=== STEP 1: INSPECTING SAVED MILITARY RESEARCH DATA ===\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of our saved military analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace, 'military_operations_connection_analysis.json') if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print(f'Found previous military analysis file: {analysis_file}') # Inspect the file structure before loading with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: file_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(file_content):,} characters') # Parse and inspect structure try: military_data = json.loads(file_content) print('\nFile structure inspection:') for key in military_data.keys(): if isinstance(military_data[key], dict): print(f' {key}: dict with {len(military_data[key])} keys') for subkey in list(military_data[key].keys())[:3]: # Show first 3 subkeys print(f' - {subkey}') elif isinstance(military_data[key], list): print(f' {key}: list with {len(military_data[key])} items') else: print(f' {key}: {type(military_data[key]).__name__}') print(f'\nKey findings from previous research:') if 'search_summary' in military_data: summary = military_data['search_summary'] print(f' - Total queries executed: {summary.get("total_queries", "unknown")}') print(f' - Total results collected: {summary.get("total_results", "unknown")}') print(f' - Promising results identified: {summary.get("promising_results", "unknown")}') print(f' - Sources accessed: {summary.get("accessed_sources", "unknown")}') if 'military_term_analysis' in military_data: terms = military_data['military_term_analysis'] print(f'\n Key military terms found:') for term, count in terms.items(): if count > 0: print(f' {term}: {count} occurrences') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'Error parsing JSON file: {e}') military_data = None else: print('No previous military analysis file found') military_data = None print('\n=== STEP 2: INSPECTING SAVED MILITARY SOURCE CONTENT ===\n') # Check what military source files we have source_files = [] for filename in os.listdir(workspace): if filename.startswith('military_source_') and filename.endswith('.txt'): source_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(source_files)} military source files:') for i, filename in enumerate(source_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING MOST PROMISING MILITARY SOURCES ===\n') # Analyze the content of our military source files for specific information analyzed_sources = [] for source_file in source_files: print(f'Analyzing: {source_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace, source_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() # Extract metadata from file header lines = content.split('\n') metadata = {} for line in lines[:10]: # Check first 10 lines for metadata if ':' in line and not line.startswith('='): key, value = line.split(':', 1) metadata[key.strip()] = value.strip() print(f' Source metadata:') for key, value in metadata.items(): print(f' {key}: {value[:80]}...' if len(value) > 80 else f' {key}: {value}') # Analyze content for specific military information content_lower = content.lower() # Look for specific destroyer mentions destroyer_patterns = [ 'destroyer', 'dd-', 'uss ', 'destroyer division', 'desron', 'desdiv' ] # Look for submarine mentions submarine_patterns = [ 'submarine', 'ss-', 'sub ', 'submarine division', 'subron', 'subdiv' ] # Look for command transition indicators command_patterns = [ 'commanding officer', 'commander', 'captain', 'command', 'transferred', 'assigned', 'relieved', 'appointed', 'promoted' ] # Count patterns destroyer_count = sum(content_lower.count(pattern) for pattern in destroyer_patterns) submarine_count = sum(content_lower.count(pattern) for pattern in submarine_patterns) command_count = sum(content_lower.count(pattern) for pattern in command_patterns) print(f' Content analysis:') print(f' Destroyer references: {destroyer_count}') print(f' Submarine references: {submarine_count}') print(f' Command references: {command_count}') # Look for specific Operation Forager and Midnight Sun references forager_refs = content_lower.count('forager') + content_lower.count('mariana') + content_lower.count('saipan') + content_lower.count('guam') midnight_sun_refs = content_lower.count('midnight sun') + content_lower.count('soviet nuclear') + content_lower.count('intelligence mission') print(f' Operation Forager context: {forager_refs}') print(f' Operation Midnight Sun context: {midnight_sun_refs}') # Extract potential ship names and officer names ship_names = [] officer_names = [] # Simple extraction of USS ship names words = content.split() for i, word in enumerate(words): if word.upper() == 'USS' and i + 1 < len(words): next_word = words[i + 1].strip('.,;:()[]') if len(next_word) > 2 and next_word[0].isupper(): ship_names.append(f'USS {next_word}') # Look for DD- designations if word.upper().startswith('DD-') and len(word) > 3: ship_names.append(word.upper()) # Remove duplicates ship_names = list(set(ship_names)) if ship_names: print(f' Ships mentioned: {ship_names[:8]}') analyzed_sources.append({ 'filename': source_file, 'metadata': metadata, 'destroyer_count': destroyer_count, 'submarine_count': submarine_count, 'command_count': command_count, 'forager_refs': forager_refs, 'midnight_sun_refs': midnight_sun_refs, 'ship_names': ship_names[:10], 'content_size': len(content) }) except Exception as e: print(f' Error analyzing {source_file}: {str(e)}') print() print('=== STEP 4: TARGETED SEARCHES FOR SPECIFIC NAVAL CONNECTIONS ===\n') # Based on our analysis, conduct more targeted searches print('Conducting targeted searches for naval command connections...') searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) targeted_queries = [ 'Operation Forager destroyer commanders Task Force 58 Pacific Fleet', 'Operation Midnight Sun Soviet submarine commander defection US Navy', 'WWII destroyer captain former submarine commander Pacific Fleet', 'Operation Forager USS destroyer commanding officers 1944', 'Soviet submarine commander Operation Midnight Sun nuclear intelligence', 'Pacific Fleet destroyer division commanders Operation Forager', 'submarine commander transferred destroyer command WWII Pacific', 'Operation Forager naval order of battle destroyers commanders' ] targeted_results = [] for query in targeted_queries: print(f'\nTargeted search: {query}') try: results = searcher.text(query, max_results=6, backend=['google', 'duckduckgo', 'bing'], safesearch='off', region='en-us') if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for i, result in enumerate(results, 1): print(f' {i}. {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["href"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["body"][:120]}...') # Score this result for relevance combined_text = (result['title'] + ' ' + result['body']).lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value scoring for command connections if 'destroyer' in combined_text and 'commander' in combined_text: relevance_score += 5 if 'submarine' in combined_text and 'commander' in combined_text: relevance_score += 5 if 'forager' in combined_text: relevance_score += 3 if 'midnight sun' in combined_text: relevance_score += 3 if 'transferred' in combined_text or 'assigned' in combined_text: relevance_score += 2 if 'pacific fleet' in combined_text: relevance_score += 2 if 'task force' in combined_text: relevance_score += 1 targeted_results.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['href'], 'snippet': result['body'], 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) print() else: print('No results found for this query') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in targeted search "{query}": {str(e)}') continue print('=== STEP 5: ANALYZING TARGETED SEARCH RESULTS ===\n') # Sort targeted results by relevance score targeted_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print(f'Collected {len(targeted_results)} targeted search results') print('\nTop 10 most relevant targeted results:') for i, result in enumerate(targeted_results[:10], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Relevance Score: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f' Query: {result["query"][:60]}...') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:150]}...') print('\n=== STEP 6: ACCESSING HIGHEST-VALUE TARGETED SOURCES ===\n') # Access the most promising targeted results headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } accessed_targeted_content = [] # Focus on results with high relevance scores high_value_results = [r for r in targeted_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 5] print(f'Accessing {len(high_value_results)} high-value targeted sources...') for i, result in enumerate(high_value_results[:4], 1): # Access top 4 high-value results print(f'\nAccessing targeted source {i}: {result["title"][:60]}...') print(f'URL: {result["url"]}') print(f'Relevance score: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Query context: {result["query"][:80]}...') try: response = requests.get(result['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: print(f'Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(['script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Get clean text content text_content = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() for line in text_content.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(' ')) clean_text = ' '.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk) # Save the targeted content content_file = os.path.join(workspace, f'targeted_source_{i}_score_{result["relevance_score"]}.txt') with open(content_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(f'URL: {result["url"]}\n') f.write(f'Title: {result["title"]}\n') f.write(f'Relevance Score: {result["relevance_score"]}\n') f.write(f'Query: {result["query"]}\n') f.write('\n' + '='*80 + '\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f'✓ Targeted content saved to: {content_file}') # Analyze for specific command connections content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look for destroyer names and hull numbers destroyer_matches = [] submarine_matches = [] commander_matches = [] words = clean_text.split() for j, word in enumerate(words): # USS destroyer names if word.upper() == 'USS' and j + 1 < len(words): next_word = words[j + 1].strip('.,;:()[]') if len(next_word) > 2: ship_name = f'USS {next_word}' if 'destroyer' in clean_text[max(0, clean_text.lower().find(ship_name.lower()) - 100):clean_text.lower().find(ship_name.lower()) + 100].lower(): destroyer_matches.append(ship_name) elif 'submarine' in clean_text[max(0, clean_text.lower().find(ship_name.lower()) - 100):clean_text.lower().find(ship_name.lower()) + 100].lower(): submarine_matches.append(ship_name) # Commander/Captain names if word.lower() in ['commander', 'captain'] and j + 1 < len(words): next_word = words[j + 1].strip('.,;:()[]') if len(next_word) > 2 and next_word[0].isupper(): commander_matches.append(f'{word} {next_word}') # Remove duplicates destroyer_matches = list(set(destroyer_matches)) submarine_matches = list(set(submarine_matches)) commander_matches = list(set(commander_matches)) print(f' Analysis results:') if destroyer_matches: print(f' Destroyers identified: {destroyer_matches[:5]}') if submarine_matches: print(f' Submarines identified: {submarine_matches[:5]}') if commander_matches: print(f' Commanders identified: {commander_matches[:8]}') # Look for command transition language transition_indicators = [ 'transferred from', 'assigned to', 'relieved command', 'assumed command', 'previously commanded', 'former commander', 'prior assignment' ] transitions_found = [] for indicator in transition_indicators: if indicator in content_lower: transitions_found.append(indicator) if transitions_found: print(f' Command transition indicators: {transitions_found}') accessed_targeted_content.append({ 'url': result['url'], 'title': result['title'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'query': result['query'], 'content_file': content_file, 'destroyers_found': destroyer_matches[:5], 'submarines_found': submarine_matches[:5], 'commanders_found': commander_matches[:8], 'transition_indicators': transitions_found, 'content_size': len(clean_text) }) else: print(f' Failed to access: HTTP {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' Error accessing URL: {str(e)}') time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting print('\n=== STEP 7: COMPREHENSIVE PHASE 2 ANALYSIS ===\n') print('🎯 PHASE 2 RESEARCH SUMMARY:') print(f'✓ Analyzed {len(source_files)} previously saved military sources') print(f'✓ Executed {len(targeted_queries)} targeted naval connection searches') print(f'✓ Collected {len(targeted_results)} targeted search results') print(f'✓ Identified {len(high_value_results)} high-value results (score ≥ 5)') print(f'✓ Successfully accessed {len(accessed_targeted_content)} detailed targeted sources') print('\n📊 CONSOLIDATED FINDINGS:') # Consolidate all ship and commander information all_destroyers = set() all_submarines = set() all_commanders = set() # From analyzed sources for source in analyzed_sources: all_destroyers.update([ship for ship in source['ship_names'] if 'destroyer' in ship.lower() or ship.startswith('DD-')]) all_submarines.update([ship for ship in source['ship_names'] if 'submarine' in ship.lower() or ship.startswith('SS-')]) # From targeted content for content in accessed_targeted_content: all_destroyers.update(content['destroyers_found']) all_submarines.update(content['submarines_found']) all_commanders.update(content['commanders_found']) print(f'\nConsolidated military assets identified:') print(f' Destroyers: {len(all_destroyers)} unique vessels') if all_destroyers: print(f' Examples: {list(all_destroyers)[:8]}') print(f' Submarines: {len(all_submarines)} unique vessels') if all_submarines: print(f' Examples: {list(all_submarines)[:8]}') print(f' Commanders: {len(all_commanders)} unique officers') if all_commanders: print(f' Examples: {list(all_commanders)[:10]}') # Look for potential connections print('\n🔍 POTENTIAL COMMAND CONNECTIONS:') connection_candidates = [] for content in accessed_targeted_content: if content['transition_indicators'] and (content['destroyers_found'] or content['submarines_found']): connection_candidates.append({ 'source': content['title'][:60], 'destroyers': content['destroyers_found'], 'submarines': content['submarines_found'], 'commanders': content['commanders_found'], 'transitions': content['transition_indicators'], 'relevance_score': content['relevance_score'] }) if connection_candidates: print(f'Found {len(connection_candidates)} potential connection sources:') for i, candidate in enumerate(connection_candidates, 1): print(f'\n {i}. Source: {candidate["source"]}...') print(f' Relevance: {candidate["relevance_score"]}') if candidate['destroyers']: print(f' Destroyers: {candidate["destroyers"]}') if candidate['submarines']: print(f' Submarines: {candidate["submarines"]}') if candidate['commanders']: print(f' Commanders: {candidate["commanders"][:5]}') print(f' Transition indicators: {candidate["transitions"]}') else: print('No clear command connection candidates identified yet') print('\n📋 NEXT RESEARCH PRIORITIES:') print('1. Search for specific destroyer rosters and commanding officer lists from Operation Forager') print('2. Research Operation Midnight Sun submarine commander identities and post-mission assignments') print('3. Cross-reference naval personnel records for officers who served in both submarine and destroyer commands') print('4. Look for specific time periods and transfer orders between submarine and destroyer assignments') print('5. Search for naval intelligence records linking Soviet submarine operations to US destroyer commands') # Save comprehensive Phase 2 analysis phase2_analysis = { 'research_objective': 'Identify destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun', 'phase2_summary': { 'sources_analyzed': len(source_files), 'targeted_queries': len(targeted_queries), 'targeted_results': len(targeted_results), 'high_value_results': len(high_value_results), 'accessed_sources': len(accessed_targeted_content) }, 'consolidated_assets': { 'destroyers_identified': list(all_destroyers), 'submarines_identified': list(all_submarines), 'commanders_identified': list(all_commanders) }, 'connection_candidates': connection_candidates, 'analyzed_sources_summary': analyzed_sources, 'accessed_targeted_content_summary': accessed_targeted_content, 'next_research_priorities': [ 'Specific Operation Forager destroyer rosters and CO lists', 'Operation Midnight Sun submarine commander identification', 'Naval personnel records cross-reference', 'Transfer orders and assignment timelines', 'Naval intelligence records linking operations' ], 'timestamp': 'phase2_detailed_analysis_complete' } phase2_file = os.path.join(workspace, 'phase2_military_connection_analysis.json') with open(phase2_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(phase2_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n✓ Phase 2 comprehensive analysis saved to: {phase2_file}') print('\n*** PHASE 2: DETAILED MILITARY RECORDS ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***') print('Status: Successfully analyzed existing data and conducted targeted searches') print('Progress: Identified potential command connection sources and consolidated military asset lists') print('Next: Phase 3 will focus on specific destroyer rosters and submarine commander identification') print('\nFiles created in Phase 2:') for filename in os.listdir(workspace): if 'targeted_source_' in filename or 'phase2_' in filename: print(f' - {filename}')
Execution Output
Code Output: === PHASE 2: DETAILED MILITARY RECORDS & COMMAND CONNECTION ANALYSIS === Objective: Identify specific destroyer from Operation Forager commanded by officer who previously commanded submarine in Operation Midnight Sun Strategy: Analyze saved military data and conduct targeted searches for naval command connections ✓ Workspace directory ready: workspace_webshaper_32 === STEP 1: INSPECTING SAVED MILITARY RESEARCH DATA === Found previous military analysis file: workspace_webshaper_32/military_operations_connection_analysis.json File size: 8,980 characters File structure inspection: research_objective: str operations_researched: dict with 2 keys - operation_forager - operation_midnight_sun search_summary: dict with 4 keys - total_queries - total_results - promising_results military_term_analysis: dict with 15 keys - destroyer - submarine - commander top_promising_results: list with 10 items accessed_military_content_summary: list with 3 items next_research_targets: list with 5 items timestamp: str Key findings from previous research: - Total queries executed: 15 - Total results collected: 120 - Promising results identified: 41 - Sources accessed: 3 Key military terms found: destroyer: 12 occurrences submarine: 48 occurrences commander: 38 occurrences captain: 12 occurrences forager: 31 occurrences midnight sun: 1 occurrences saipan: 13 occurrences guam: 13 occurrences mariana: 10 occurrences soviet: 21 occurrences nuclear: 17 occurrences uss: 24 occurrences naval: 32 occurrences pacific: 45 occurrences wwii: 2 occurrences === STEP 2: INSPECTING SAVED MILITARY SOURCE CONTENT === Found 3 military source files: 1. military_source_5_midnight_sun.txt (16,480 bytes) 2. military_source_4_midnight_sun.txt (47,805 bytes) 3. military_source_2_connection.txt (38,964 bytes) === STEP 3: ANALYZING MOST PROMISING MILITARY SOURCES === Analyzing: military_source_5_midnight_sun.txt Source metadata: URL: https://quietwarriors.wordpress.com/2014/05/30/diesel-sub-commander-recalls-hist... Targeted search: Operation Forager destroyer commanders Task Force 58 Pacific Fleet Found 6 results 1. Operation Forager logistics... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Forager_logistics Snippet: Operation Forager , the U.S. invasion of the Mariana Islands during World War II, involved the movement and support of a... 2. Operation Forager | Task Force 58 / 38... URL: https://www.taskforce58.org/operations/operation-forager/ Snippet: OPERATION FORAGER 6/6/44 – 8/15/44. MARIANA ISLANDS.
